title: Yes, nutrition advice changes – and that's a good thing
text:
Yes or no. Left or right. In or out. Life is full of decisions – in fact, according to a study at Cornell University, we make over 200 a day about food alone.

Most of those decisions won't take a moment's thought (that breakfast you have every morning); some of them probably require a few seconds of deliberations (white or brown bread?); and one or two might spark a heated conversation with a housemate or loved one ("you know I hate pineapple on my pizza!"). Whatever the case, we reserve the right to change our minds, either on a whim, after further thought, or when some new information comes to light (for example, the Greek yoghurt has gone mouldy).

Nutritional science is not so lucky – or rather...
